description: The story is about a girl named Ronja who is the daughter of a chief of a tribe of bandits and lives in a huge castle in the forest with the bandits. The story follows Ronja as she encounters mystical creatures, makes friends with another young child like herself, and experiences life in the forest.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
Gorou Miyazaki is a Japanese film director and the son of [Akemi](https://anilist.co/staff/168110/) and [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/)

While growing up, Gorou and his younger brother Keisuke found sketches of their parents' work. As a high school student, Gorou thought that he "would never be able to reach the level his father has attained." Gorou instead decided to pursue an interest in landscape architecture. After graduating from Shinshu University's School of Agriculture, Gorou later worked as a construction consultant in the planning and designing of parks and gardens. In 1998, Gorou was involved in the design of the Ghibli Museum in Mitaka, and served as its director from 2001 to June 2005.

Miyazaki's first film was [Tales from Earthsea](https://anilist.co/anime/1829/), an adaptation of [Ursula K. Le Guin](https://anilist.co/staff/117335/)'s Earthsea book series. Originally joining the animation project as a consultant, Miyazaki was asked to draw the storyboards. After viewing his storyboards, producer [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) decided Miyazaki should direct the film. The move to direct the film caused friction between Gorou and his father, who felt his son did not have the experience to direct a film; the two were said not to have spoken throughout the movie's development. Despite this, Gorou Miyazaki was determined to complete the project.

The film was released on July 29, 2006 to positive reviews, but received mixed reviews when compared to the other Ghibli movies, and grossed $68 million worldwide. However, Miyazaki was presented Japan's Bunshun Raspberry Award for "Worst Director", with Tales from Earthsea receiving the award for "Worst Movie", at the end of 2006. The film was nominated in 2007 for the Japan Academy Prize for Animation of the Year (losing to [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/)) and was selected in the Out of Competition section at the 63rd Venice Film Festival.

In 2011, Miyazaki directed [From up on Poppy Hill](https://anilist.co/anime/10029/), which is based on an ‘80s manga [Coquelicot-zaka kara](https://anilist.co/manga/53614/). The film was released on July 16, 2011 in Japan, to positive reviews. The film won the 2012 Japan Academy Prize for Animation of the Year.

Brother of [Keisuke Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/222813/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kawasak54965532)

Hiroyuki Kawasaki is a screenwriter and novelist.
Astrid Anna Emilia Lindgren (née Ericsson) was a Swedish writer of fiction and screenplays.
Marie-Line Landerwijn is a Belgian Actress, Voice Actress, Art Director and ADR Director.

Gorou Miyazaki is a Japanese film director and the son of [Akemi](https://anilist.co/staff/168110/) and [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/)

In 1998, Gorou was involved in the design of the Ghibli Museum in Mitaka, and served as its director from 2001 to June 2005.

Miyazaki's first film was [Tales from Earthsea](https://anilist.co/anime/1829/), an adaptation of [Ursula K. Le Guin](https://anilist.co/staff/117335/)'s Earthsea book series. After viewing his storyboards, producer [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) decided Miyazaki should direct the film. The move to direct the film caused friction between Gorou and his father, who felt his son did not have the experience to direct a film; the two were said not to have spoken throughout the movie's development. Despite this, Gorou Miyazaki was determined to complete the project.

The film was released on July 29, 2006 to positive reviews, but received mixed reviews when compared to the other Ghibli movies, and grossed $68 million worldwide. Brother of [Keisuke Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/222813/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/近藤勝也)

Famous for his character designs on numerous of [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s films, which are considered the epitome of the Ghibli style.

After graduating from high school, he began working for [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/) at their Studio Annapuru. Under the direction of [Shinji Ootsuka](https://anilist.co/staff/124192/), Kondou worked as a key animator of the TV anime series Cat's Eye. He then worked as a free agent on such shows as [The Mighty Orbots](https://anilist.co/anime/8130/), Rainbow Brite and Disney's Adventures of the Gummi Bears. His first work with Studio Ghibli was as a key animator on [Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/). After working on the Gainax film [The Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/) and multiple OVAs around late '80s, Kondou began to be known for the high quality of his work.

He has also collaborated collaborated with Kenichi Sakemi on a manga retelling of the Joan of Arc story, as well as doing the character designs for the Jade Cocoon video game series.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Marie-Line Landerwijn is a Belgian Actress, Voice Actress, Art Director and ADR Director.

**Height:** 162 cm (5' 3¾")

Actress and voice-over artist from Norway. Silje was raised in Lillestrøm, and is the youngest out of five siblings. She has been singing since she was 5 years old, and her dream is to become a professional musical artist, and an actress.

She attended Bårdar Academy, studying Musicaltheatre (2013-15) and Lillestrøm High school, Dramatic Arts (2010-13).

(Source: imdb)
Hans Ola Jonsson also know as Hasse Jonsson is a Swedish actor and voice actor, as well as working as ADR Director on multiple Swedish dubs of anime.
Hans Ola Jonsson also know as Hasse Jonsson is a Swedish actor and voice actor, as well as working as ADR Director on multiple Swedish dubs of anime.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Bhagga)

Anoo Bhagavan is a Swedish translator and songwriter. He is married to Swedish actress [Annelie Bhagavan](https://anilist.co/staff/286651/Annelie-Maria-Berg-Bhagavan).
Thomas Gustafsson is the former Chief Business at The Astrid Lindgren Company and the current Vice President Acquisition's European division.

Johan Palmberg is the current rights manager for  Astrid Lindgren AB. Great-grandson of [Astrid Lindgren](https://anilist.co/staff/140833/Astrid-Lindgren), grandnephew of [Karin Nyman](https://anilist.co/staff/312993/Karin-Nyman) and first cousin, once removed with [Malin Billing](https://anilist.co/staff/312990/Malin-Billing) and [Nils Nyman](https://anilist.co/staff/312992/Nils-Nyman)

Malin Billing is the Senior adviser Corporate values of the Astrid Lindgren Company. She's granddaughter of [Astrid Lindgren](https://anilist.co/staff/140833/Astrid-Lindgren), daughter of [Karin Nyman](https://anilist.co/staff/312993/Karin-Nyman), sister of [Nils Nyman](https://anilist.co/staff/312992/Nils-Nyman) and second cousin, once removed with [Johan Palmberg](https://anilist.co/staff/312989/Johan-Palmberg)
